import React from "react" import axios from 'axios' //path must be changed accordingly to the param query input import XMLData from './xml/mc.xml' class Question extends React.Component{ //questionNum = this.props.questionNum state = { questionText: "", questionNum: this.props.questionNum } componentDidMount(){ axios.get(XMLData, {"Content-Type":"application/xml; charset=utf-8" }).then((response)=>{ //there is no need to parse this everytime there is a mount, //only need to parse it when the page is loaded console.log(response.datas) const parser = new DOMParser() var xml = parser.parseFromString(response.data,"text/xml") var questionText = xml.getElementsByTagName("questiontext")[this.state.questionNum].childNodes[0].nodeValue console.log(questionText.replace("
","
!")) //.innerHTML <= should I use innerHTML?? //should I change parse xml as a string or as an JSX object? this.setState({ questionText: questionText.replace("
","
!") }) }) } render(){ return(

{this.state.questionNum+1}

{this.state.questionText}

) } } export default Question
